intro: Basanacantha erythropoda, commonly known as the red-flowered spurge, is a perennial plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, succulent stems and lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
